guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body:
The rule was never explicitly stated in the ToS. [Captainmeta4 even admitted that it was unclear and is saying a clarification of the rule is going to be posted later](https://ruqqus.com/+Klenvastergan/post/571e/lmao-i-am-literally-such-a/hzqm).

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

The rule was never explicitly stated in the ToS. Captainmeta4 even admitted that it was unclear and is saying a clarification of the rule is going to be posted later.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

body: Ruqqus preventing you from modding over 10 guilds with a message that you can only mod 10 if you attempt to mod or create an 11th one should have been enough for anyone with at least 2 brain cells to rub together. Yes @captainmeta4 does have some of the blame, but it's not like the limit was this mystical unknown that he's just now springing onto people. The 10 Guild limit was one of the main selling points so to say of Ruqqus.
body_html: Ruqqus preventing you from modding over 10 guilds with a message that you can only mod 10 if you attempt to mod or create an 11th one should have been enough for anyone with at least 2 brain cells to rub together. Yes @captainmeta4 does have some of the blame, but it's not like the limit was this mystical unknown that he's just now springing onto people. The 10 Guild limit was one of the main selling points so to say of Ruqqus.

body:
From another comment of mine:

>Let's say I hypothetically have 10 alts, and I mod 8 different guilds on each of them. As far as I know, I will never encounter the "10 guilds limit" message, and thus I won't have a way of telling that the limit exists.

Let's assume that I read the TOS and Content Policy, but not any of the posts or comments promoting the 10 guild limit. How would I be able to know that I broke a rule?

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
From another comment of mine:

Let's say I hypothetically have 10 alts, and I mod 8 different guilds on each of them. As far as I know, I will never encounter the "10 guilds limit" message, and thus I won't have a way of telling that the limit exists.

Let's assume that I read the TOS and Content Policy, but not any of the posts or comments promoting the 10 guild limit. How would I be able to know that I broke a rule?

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

parent.body: Ruqqus preventing you from modding over 10 guilds with a message that you can only mod 10 if you attempt to mod or create an 11th one should have been enough for anyone with at least 2 brain cells to rub together. Yes @captainmeta4 does have some of the blame, but it's not like the limit was this mystical unknown that he's just now springing onto people. The 10 Guild limit was one of the main selling points so to say of Ruqqus.

body:
The disabled "Create Guild" button and obvious message above said button isn't enough? Do you think they just put that there for shits and giggles or do you think they intended there to be a 10 guild limit?

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/i2x1/OTH3Ii5oro8)

body:
I literally said in my comment that I mod **8** guilds on each account in my hypothetical situation. If I have 8 guilds, I will never see that message unless I go looking in the source. How many users would you expect to do that?

I also never said that I didn't think the 10 guild limit existed. All my comments are about the clarity of the rules, not the fact that the limit exists.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
I literally said in my comment that I mod 8 guilds on each account in my hypothetical situation. If I have 8 guilds, I will never see that message unless I go looking in the source. How many users would you expect to do that?

I also never said that I didn't think the 10 guild limit existed. All my comments are about the clarity of the rules, not the fact that the limit exists.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

body:
Who cares if there's a legitimate reason? That's entirely irrelevant here. All I'm trying to say is that this limitation isn't as clear as it's supposed to be, and I disagree with Klenny's ban because of it. If the admins had written in the TOS that it was against the rules, I would've agreed with the ban. But currently, if you don't already have 10 guilds, there's no way to tell the limit exists by looking at the rules/TOS, the guild creation page, the left sidebar, the guildmaster tools page, or even the help pages, and that's just not transparent. And nowhere does it say that using alts to circumvent the limit is against the rules (I know the admins will be clarifying it later though). For this reason, I think that the ban was not justified, so I would like the admins to unban Klenny and give his 10 guilds back.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Who cares if there's a legitimate reason? That's entirely irrelevant here. All I'm trying to say is that this limitation isn't as clear as it's supposed to be, and I disagree with Klenny's ban because of it. If the admins had written in the TOS that it was against the rules, I would've agreed with the ban. But currently, if you don't already have 10 guilds, there's no way to tell the limit exists by looking at the rules/TOS, the guild creation page, the left sidebar, the guildmaster tools page, or even the help pages, and that's just not transparent. And nowhere does it say that using alts to circumvent the limit is against the rules (I know the admins will be clarifying it later though). For this reason, I think that the ban was not justified, so I would like the admins to unban Klenny and give his 10 guilds back.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]
